page.title: 15CHANGES IN SOCIAL LIFE(CONT)
page.content: In 1945 there were few council houses and working hours were reduced. The treatment of T.B. was improved. By 1965 the village expanded and more jobs were available. Housing food and medicine improved, children left school at 15 and the curriculum became more varied. V.E. day 1945. The end of the war was celebrated by parties and dancing in the street. Coronation Day 1953. Some watched the ceremony on television. Many people coming together in one house because of the lack of televisions. Street parties were held at a later date because of the wet weather. All the children at school received a souvenir mug with the Queen's picture and the coronation date - June 2nd 1953 - on it.
